trans-unit.source: A context menu provides the user with instant actions.
trans-unit.target: A context menu provides the user with instant actions.

trans-unit.source: It can be filled with custom commands.
trans-unit.target: It can be filled with custom commands.

trans-unit.source: Context menus can be dismissed by tapping or clicking somewhere outside the menu.
trans-unit.target: Context menus can be dismissed by tapping or clicking somewhere outside the menu.

trans-unit.source: Dialogs are modal UI overlays that provide contextual app information.
trans-unit.target: Dialogs are modal UI overlays that provide contextual app information.

trans-unit.source: In most cases, dialogs block interactions with the app window until being explicitly dismissed, and often request some kind of action from the user.
trans-unit.target: In most cases, dialogs block interactions with the app window until being explicitly dismissed, and often request some kind of action from the user.

trans-unit.source: A popup, also known as a flyout, is a lightweight contextual popup that displays UI related to what the user is doing.
trans-unit.target: A popup, also known as a flyout, is a lightweight contextual popup that displays UI related to what the user is doing.

trans-unit.source: It includes placement and sizing logic, and can be used to show a menu, reveal a hidden control, show more detail about an item, or ask the user to confirm an action.
trans-unit.target: It includes placement and sizing logic, and can be used to show a menu, reveal a hidden control, show more detail about an item, or ask the user to confirm an action.

trans-unit.source: Popups can be dismissed by tapping or clicking somewhere outside the popup.

trans-unit.source: Dialogs
trans-unit.target: Dialogs

trans-unit.source: Clearly identify the issue or the user's objective in the first line of the dialog's text.
trans-unit.target: Clearly identify the issue or the user's objective in the first line of the dialog's text.

trans-unit.source: The dialog title is the main instruction and is optional.
trans-unit.target: The dialog title is the main instruction and is optional.

trans-unit.source: Use a short title to explain what people need to do with the dialog.
trans-unit.target: Use a short title to explain what people need to do with the dialog.

trans-unit.source: Long titles do not wrap and are truncated.
trans-unit.target: Long titles do not wrap and are truncated.

trans-unit.source: If you're using the dialog to deliver a simple message, error or question, you can optionally omit the title.
trans-unit.target: If you're using the dialog to deliver a simple message, error or question, you can optionally omit the title.

trans-unit.source: Rely on the content text to deliver that core information.
trans-unit.target: Rely on the content text to deliver that core information.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the title relates directly to the button choices.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the title relates directly to the button choices.

trans-unit.source: The dialog content contains the descriptive text and is required.
trans-unit.target: The dialog content contains the descriptive text and is required.

trans-unit.source: Present the message, error, or blocking question as simply as possible.
trans-unit.target: Present the message, error, or blocking question as simply as possible.

trans-unit.source: If a dialog title is used, use the content area to provide more detail or define terminology.
trans-unit.target: If a dialog title is used, use the content area to provide more detail or define terminology.

trans-unit.source: Don't repeat the title with slightly different wording.
trans-unit.target: Don't repeat the title with slightly different wording.

trans-unit.source: At least one dialog button must appear.
trans-unit.target: At least one dialog button must appear.

trans-unit.source: Use buttons with text that identifies specific responses to the main instruction or content.
trans-unit.target: Use buttons with text that identifies specific responses to the main instruction or content.

trans-unit.source: An example is, "Do you want to allow AppName to access your location?", followed by "Allow" and "Block" buttons.
trans-unit.target: An example is, "Do you want to allow AppName to access your location?", followed by "Allow" and "Block" buttons.

trans-unit.source: Specific responses can be understood more quickly, resulting in efficient decision making.
trans-unit.target: Specific responses can be understood more quickly, resulting in efficient decision making.

trans-unit.source: Error dialogs display the error message in the dialog box, along with any pertinent information.
trans-unit.target: Error dialogs display the error message in the dialog box, along with any pertinent information.

trans-unit.source: The only button used in an error dialog should be “Close” or a similar action.
trans-unit.target: The only button used in an error dialog should be “Close” or a similar action.

trans-unit.source: Don't use dialogs for errors that are contextual to a specific place on the page, such as validation errors (in password fields, for example), use the app's canvas itself to show inline errors.
trans-unit.target: Don't use dialogs for errors that are contextual to a specific place on the page, such as validation errors (in password fields, for example), use the app's canvas itself to show inline errors.

trans-unit.source: Popups
trans-unit.target: Popups

trans-unit.source: As with other contextual UI, place a popup next to the point from which it's called.
trans-unit.target: As with other contextual UI, place a popup next to the point from which it's called.

trans-unit.source: Specify the object to which you want the popup anchored, and the side of the object on which the popup will appear.
trans-unit.target: Specify the object to which you want the popup anchored, and the side of the object on which the popup will appear.

trans-unit.source: Try to position the popup so that it doesn’t block important UI.
trans-unit.target: Try to position the popup so that it doesn’t block important UI.

trans-unit.source: The popup should be dismissed as soon as something in it is selected.
trans-unit.target: The popup should be dismissed as soon as something in it is selected.

trans-unit.source: Popup menus work best with just one level.
trans-unit.target: Popup menus work best with just one level.

trans-unit.source: Multiple popup menu levels are difficult to navigate and provide a poor user experience.
trans-unit.target: Multiple popup menu levels are difficult to navigate and provide a poor user experience.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: Keep context menu commands short.
trans-unit.target: Keep context menu commands short.

trans-unit.source: Longer commands end up being truncated.
trans-unit.target: Longer commands end up being truncated.

trans-unit.source: Use sentence capitalization for each command name.
trans-unit.target: Use sentence capitalization for each command name.

trans-unit.source: In any context menu, show the fewest possible number of commands.
trans-unit.target: In any context menu, show the fewest possible number of commands.

trans-unit.source: If direct manipulation of a UI element is possible, avoid placing that command within a context menu.
trans-unit.target: If direct manipulation of a UI element is possible, avoid placing that command within a context menu.

trans-unit.source: A context menu should be reserved for contextual commands that aren't otherwise discoverable on-screen.
trans-unit.target: A context menu should be reserved for contextual commands that aren't otherwise discoverable on-screen.
